ABk.caption: This action makes use of the operator :format as text on a list. You will need to format the list content as a JSON object and use a ',' as the delimiter.
ABk.name: info

ABn.caption: Here you can set the delimiter for your exported file. By default it will use a comma as the delimiter but you can set this to anything you like.
ABn.name: here_you_can_set_the_delimiter_for_your_exported_file._by_default_it_will_use_a_comma_as_the_delimiter_but_you_can_set_this_to_anything_you_like._

ABo.caption: To create a tab delimiter, set this value to ‘tab’ (don’t include the quotes)
ABo.name: to_create_a_tab_delimiter,_set_this_value_to_‘tab’_(don’t_include_the_quotes)

ABp.caption: Note, using a space, ↵, ", or an empty delimiter will result in a comma being substituted in the exported file.
ABp.name: note,_using_a_space,_↵,_",_or_an_empty_delimiter_will_result_in_a_comma_being_substituted_in_the_exported_file.

ABs.caption: ALLOW USER TO SAVE THE FILE
ABs.name: save_file

ACP.caption: If this box is unchecked your user will not be given the option to save the file directly to their computer
ACP.name: user_save_file_info

ACQ.caption: With any CSV that contains user generated content, there is the risk of the user entering data that can be run as a function when the CSV is imported into a spreadsheet tool (ie, Excel, Numbers, etc) You should take your own precautions if this vulnerability is a concern.
ACQ.name: csv_injection_info
